snippet: Senior White House officials say the administration is open to ways in which insurers can handle more enrollments and has stepped up efforts to make that possible.
abstract: Some major health insurers are pushing the government to create shortcut that would allow them to enroll people entitled to subsidies directly rather than through troubled health care Web site; White House officials say the administration is open to ways in which insurers can handle more enrollments and has stepped up efforts to make that possible.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON, SHARON LaFRANIERE and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Senior White House officials say the administration is open to ways in which insurers can handle more enrollments and has stepped up efforts to make that possible.

headline.main: Insurers Press for Way Around Healthcare.gov
headline.print_headline: Insurers Seek Ways To Bypass Healthcare.gov

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
